title: Question 16
prompt:
Sentence 7: I look forward to hearing your hiring decision, thank you again for your time and consideration.

Which correction should be made to sentence 7?
description: Click the <u>one best answer</u> to each question.
feedback:
Sentence 7 contains two independent clauses, or clauses which can stand alone as complete sentences. It is incorrect to join two independent clauses by a comma. This forms a type of run-on sentence often called a comma splice.

I look forward to hearing your hiring decision, thank you again for your time and consideration.

One way to fix a comma splice is to divide the run-on sentence into two complete sentences. The correct answer divides the two independent clauses.


I look forward to hearing your hiring decision. Thank you again for your time and consideration.
